trans-unit.source: Allows security actions for <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationPermission"></xref> to be applied to code using declarative security.
This permission is used by classes that provide information about network connections and traffic statistics such as those in the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation> namespace.
The security information declared by a security attribute is stored in the metadata of the attribute target and is accessed by the system at run time.
Security attributes are used only for declarative security.
For imperative security, use the <xref:System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationPermission> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationPermissionAttribute"></xref> class.
The security action defines which callers must have the permission.
A <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction"></xref> value that specifies the permission behavior.
Gets or sets the network information access level.
The valid values for this property are shown in the following table.
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |"Read"|Read access to network information.| |"Full"|Full access to network information.| |"None"|No access to network information.|
A string that specifies the access level.
Creates and returns a new <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationPermission"></xref> object.
This method should only be called by the security system, never by application code.
A <xref href="System.Net.NetworkInformation.NetworkInformationPermission"></xref> that corresponds to this attribute.
